results.title: Cesar
results.brief_description:
After his years in the merchant navy Marius runs a garage in Toulon. On the death of her husband, Panisse, Fanny reveals to her adult son Cesariot that Marius is his father. With a liitle help from grandfather Cesar, the lovers of 20 years before are reunited. This final entry in Pagnol’s Marseilles trilogy (preceded by ‘Marius’ and ‘Fanny’) is the only one of the three directed by Pagnol.

Credits: Producer, Marcel Pagnol ; director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Willy [Faktorovitch], Roger Ledru ; music, Vincent Scotto.
Cast: Raimu, Pierre Fresnay, Orane Demazis, Ropbert Vattier, Charpin, Maupi.

results.title: Cervical cancer
results.creator_credit: Russell Kightley, A Ralph Rosenthal and Health Education Video Unit, Leicestershire Health Authority
results.brief_description: Details the structure of the cervix and explains why it is particularly vulnerable to external agents. Addresses the high incidence of cervical cancer and recommends preventative strategies.

results.title: Cerveau gele
results.creator_credit: Pierre Moretti, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Claude Dubois sings out against the petrifying effect of growing cities. The images on the screen form and reform to reflect his sentiments. Music by Claude Dubois and photography by Claude Lapierre.

results.title: Certaines Nouvelles = Certain News
results.brief_description:
Algeria, 1961. Laughter and music escape from an old sea-side house. Helene, Jean and Pierre try to remain oblivious to the reality surrounding them and their own insecurities. False illusion of peace and poisonned relations with friends are their lot while they attempt to spend one last summer as if nothing was happening. Award: Prix Jean Vigo 1979.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Meurisse ; director, Jacques Davila ; writers, Jacques Davila, Marie-France Bonin ; photography, Martial Thury.
Cast: Micheline Presle, Bernadette Lafont, Caroline Cellier, Frederic de Pasquale, Roger Hanin, Martine Sarcey, Gerard Lartigau.

results.title: Certain Women
results.creator_credit: Stage 6 Films, filmscience, April Napier, Neil Kopp, Vincent Savino, Anish Savjani, Anthony Gasparro, Kelly Reichardt and Maile Meloy
results.brief_description: Based on Maile Meloy’s short story collection, Both Ways Is the Only Way I Want It, Certain Women weaves in-and-out of the lives of a small-town lawyer, a woman building a country house, a night-school teacher and an isolated ranch hand.

constellations_other.name: Amateur hour
constellations_other.description: Early sound equipment allowed filmmakers and amateurs alike the ability to experiment often with affordable 16mm film.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Stage 6 Films, filmscience, April Napier, Neil Kopp, Vincent Savino, Anish Savjani, Anthony Gasparro, Kelly Reichardt and Maile Meloy
results.description:
Michelle Williams, Laura Dern, Kristen Stewart and Lilly Gladstone star in one of the most critically lauded films of 2016.

Based on Maile Meloy’s short story collection, Both Ways Is the Only Way I Want It, Certain Women weaves in-and-out of the lives of a small-town lawyer (Dern); a woman building a country house (Williams); a night-school teacher (Stewart) and an isolated ranch hand (Gladstone).

Shifting gear from her 2013 release Night Moves, Kelly Reichardt is back in the more familiar territory of unhurried studies of time, place and human relations. The plot points driving each character aren’t the immediate concern, rather these various backdrops serve as contained universes to dive into these richly textured characters.

For her seventh feature film, Reichardt has assembled a cast featuring some of the finest actors working today. In her role as the harried night school teacher, Kristen Stewart offers another revelatory performance full of bristling, nervous energy. Likewise, Laura Dern and Reichardt-regular Michelle Williams, bring their characters to life with effortless grace, while newcomer Lilly Gladstone brings a heart-wrenching honesty that makes Certain Women unforgettable.

Winner of numerous awards including Best Film at the 2016 London Film Festival, Kelly Reichardt’s latest film confirms her as one of cinema’s foremost directors.
description_for_label:

Based on Maile Meloy’s short story collection, Both Ways Is the Only Way I Want It, Certain Women weaves in-and-out of the lives of a small-town lawyer (Dern); a woman building a country house (Williams); a night-school teacher (Stewart) and an isolated ranch hand (Gladstone).

Shifting gear from her 2013 release Night Moves, Kelly Reichardt is back in the more familiar territory of unhurried studies of time, place and human relations. The plot points driving each character aren’t the immediate concern, rather these various backdrops serve as contained universes to dive into these richly textured characters.

For her seventh feature film, Reichardt has assembled a cast featuring some of the finest actors working today. In her role as the harried night school teacher, Kristen Stewart offers another revelatory performance full of bristling, nervous energy. Likewise, Laura Dern and Reichardt-regular Michelle Williams, bring their characters to life with effortless grace, while newcomer Lilly Gladstone brings a heart-wrenching honesty that makes Certain Women unforgettable.

Winner of numerous awards including Best Film at the 2016 London Film Festival, Kelly Reichardt’s latest film confirms her as one of cinema’s foremost directors.

results.title: Ceremony
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Experimental Film and Television Fund
results.brief_description: Nearly completing his painting, the artist takes a walk outside, where his creativity manifests itself in the life around him. This experimental work captures the ritualistic spirituality of art and the art in the everyday. Paintings in the film are by Paul Mason.

results.title: Ceremonial ground painting: Aboriginal women artists from Papunya (A)
results.creator_credit: Ian Stocks, Robyn Bondfield, Queensland Art Gallery and Kopano P/L Productions
results.brief_description: Eight women artists from the Papunya community were invited to Queensland Art Gallery to create a groundpainting that would enhance and extend the exhibition “The Inspired dream: life as art in Aboriginal Australia” This video documents the making of the painting, explanations of its symbolic meaning and the dancing ceremonies which are traditionally performed when the work is finished. The artists were Emma and Mali Nungurrayi, Topsy, Mary and Jeannie Napaltjarri, Mavis Napangati, Phylis Nakamarra and Mavis Nampitjinpa.

results.title: Cerebral palsy: basic abilities
results.creator_credit: Spastic Centre of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Based on the Book “Cerebral Palsy - Basic Abilities - A plan for Training the Pre-School Child” the film carefully outlines the program used in New South Wales since 1963, in an attempt to develop visuomotor and perceptual learning skills.

results.title: Ceramic glazes
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the mixing of an opaque matt and stone glaze, both showing wide firing latitude and high colour receptivity. Glaze application by several methods is shown. Kiln interiors at intervals during firing show the progressive stages of the glaze.
